author: nero_eth
content:
I posted a short analysis on how gas refunds can be used to get a block with the max number of storage changes:
https://ethresear.ch/t/overclocking-blocks-with-gas-refunds/22862

EIP-7778 proposes that refunds for zeroing out storage slots no longer reduce the block’s gas usage. Users still receive the refund, but we don't "free" gas for a subsequent transaction. 

Since clearing a storage slot still effectively costs 200 gas, one cannot use refunds to do more <opcode> calls per block. So, it doesn’t worsen any other existing worst-case scenarios. 
Since this is worst-case for snap sync's healing, it might be nice to have tests around it, if we don't already?
